templates.name: Azure Virtual Machine by HTTP
templates.description:
This template is designed to monitor Microsoft Azure virtual machines (VMs) by HTTP.
It works without any external scripts and uses the script item.

Setup:
  1. Create an Azure service principal via the Azure command-line interface (Azure CLI) for your subscription.
    `az ad sp create-for-rbac --name zabbix --role reader --scope /subscriptions/<subscription_id>`
    See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/create-an-azure-service-principal-azure-cli for more details.
  2. Link the template to a host.
  3. Configure the macros: {$AZURE.APP.ID}, {$AZURE.PASSWORD}, {$AZURE.TENANT.ID}, {$AZURE.SUBSCRIPTION.ID}, and {$AZURE.RESOURCE.ID}.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Availability status detailed
items.description: The summary description of availability status.

items.name: Availability state
items.description: The availability status of the resource.

triggers.name: Virtual machine is degraded
triggers.description: The resource is in degraded state.

triggers.name: Virtual machine is in unknown state

items.name: VM cached bandwidth consumed percentage
items.description: The percentage of the cached disk bandwidth consumed by the VM.

items.name: VM cached IOPS consumed percentage
items.description: The percentage of the cached disk IOPS consumed by the VM.

items.name: CPU credits consumed
items.description: The total number of credits consumed by the virtual machine. Only available on B-series burstable VMs.

items.name: CPU credits remaining
items.description: The total number of credits available to burst. Available only on B-series burstable VMs.

items.name: Percentage CPU
items.description: The percentage of allocated computing units that are currently in use by VMs.

triggers.name: High CPU utilization
triggers.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

items.name: Data disk bandwidth consumed percentage
items.description: The percentage of the data disk bandwidth consumed per minute.

items.name: Data disk IOPS consumed percentage
items.description: The percentage of the data disk input/output (I/O) consumed per minute.

items.name: Data disk max burst bandwidth
items.description: The maximum bytes per second throughput that the data disk can achieve with bursting.

items.name: Data disk max burst IOPS
items.description: The maximum IOPS that the data disk can achieve with bursting.

items.name: Data disk queue depth
items.description: The number of outstanding IO requests that are waiting to be performed on a disk.

items.name: Data disk read rate
items.description: Bytes per second read from a single disk during the monitoring period.

items.name: Data disk read operations/sec
items.description: The read IOPS from a single disk during the monitoring period.

items.name: Data disk target bandwidth
items.description: Baseline bytes per second throughput that the data disk can achieve without bursting.

items.name: Data disk target IOPS
items.description: The baseline IOPS that the data disk can achieve without bursting.

items.name: Data disk used burst BPS credits percentage
items.description: The percentage of the data disk burst bandwidth credits used so far.

items.name: Data disk used burst IO credits percentage
items.description: The percentage of the data disk burst I/O credits used so far.

items.name: Data disk write rate
items.description: Bytes per second written to a single disk during the monitoring period.

items.name: Data disk write operations/sec
items.description: The write IOPS from a single disk during the monitoring period.

items.name: Get errors
items.description: A list of errors from API requests.

triggers.name: There are errors in requests to API
triggers.description: Zabbix has received errors in response to API requests.

items.name: Get data
items.description: The result of API requests is expressed in the JSON.

items.name: Disk read rate
items.description: Bytes read from the disk during the monitoring period (1 minute).

items.name: Disk read operations/sec
items.description: The count of read operations from the disk per second.

items.name: Disk write rate
items.description: Bytes written to the disk during the monitoring period (1 minute).

items.name: Disk write operations/sec
items.description: The count of write operations to the disk per second.

items.name: Inbound flows
items.description: The number of current flows in the inbound direction (the traffic going into the VM).

items.name: Inbound flows max creation rate
items.description: The maximum creation rate of the inbound flows (the traffic going into the VM).

items.name: Outbound flows
items.description: The number of current flows in the outbound direction (the traffic going out of the VM).

items.name: Outbound flows max creation rate
items.description: The maximum creation rate of the outbound flows (the traffic going out of the VM).

items.name: Available memory
items.description: The amount of physical memory (in bytes) immediately available for the allocation to a process or for a system use in the VM.

items.name: Network in total
items.description: The number of bytes received by the VMs via all network interfaces (incoming traffic).

items.name: Network out total
items.description: The number of bytes sent by the VMs via all network interfaces (outgoing traffic).

items.name: OS disk bandwidth consumed percentage
items.description: The percentage of the operating system's disk bandwidth consumed per minute.

items.name: OS disk IOPS consumed percentage
items.description: The percentage of the operating system's disk I/Os consumed per minute.

items.name: OS disk max burst bandwidth
items.description: Maximum bytes per second throughput that the OS disk can achieve with bursting.

items.name: OS disk max burst IOPS
items.description: Maximum IOPS that the OS disk can achieve with bursting.

items.name: OS disk queue depth
items.description: The OS disk queue depth (or queue length).

items.name: OS disk read rate
items.description: Bytes per second read from a single disk during the monitoring period for OS disk.

items.name: OS disk read operations/sec
items.description: The read IOPS from a single disk during the monitoring period for OS disk.

items.name: OS disk target bandwidth
items.description: Baseline bytes per second throughput that the OS disk can achieve without bursting.

items.name: OS disk target IOPS
items.description: Baseline IOPS that the OS disk can achieve without bursting.

items.name: OS disk used burst BPS credits percentage
items.description: The percentage of the OS disk burst bandwidth credits used so far.

items.name: OS disk used burst IO credits percentage
items.description: The percentage of the OS disk burst I/O credits used so far.

items.name: OS disk write rate
items.description: Bytes per second written to a single disk during the monitoring period for OS disk.

items.name: OS disk write operations/sec
items.description: The write IOPS from a single disk during the monitoring period for OS disk.

macros.description: The App ID of Microsoft Azure.
Sets HTTP proxy value. If this macro is empty then no proxy is used.
The critical threshold of CPU utilization, expressed in %.
